data.text: @FergalKey @fantomCitizen @MarcusDuffen @Ferneylfc85 @DonnellyStephen Normally a country cannot prohibit its inhabitants entrance. But it wouldn‘t be the first time that core principles of law are not considered that important if it‘s about Covid.

@fantomCitizen @meierk2022 @MarcusDuffen @Ferneylfc85 @DonnellyStephen US might let you leave, and Ireland might let you enter. But you shouldn't travel if they don't allow you to renter. I'm not sure if being a US citizen guarantees re-entry (for Canadians it doesn't when returning to Canada). You may need to be vaccinated to return to US
@fantomCitizen @meierk2022 @MarcusDuffen @Ferneylfc85 @DonnellyStephen Do not go to Ireland, If US still has vaccination requirement for entry.

@DonnellyStephen New study shows very cheap Ivermectin is 70% more effective than very expensive Remdesivir

Why was there a campaign to discount early treatment with Ivermectin?

How many lives could have been saved?

https://t.co/51J8ltbIab
@DonnellyStephen That's too bad. It's too early to nix vaccine requirements for travelers. I was planning to come in May, but will have to cancel now. I don't want a 15 hr flight with UN vaxxed. 😥
